channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Engine Shortages Have Grounded Airlines. This Company Has the Formula to Fix That.
item.description: Being a one-stop shop for leasing, repairs and parts has made FTAI one of the commercial-aviation industry’s few bright spots.

item.title: Odds shift in Trump’s favor as RFK Jr. prepares to pull out of presidential race
item.description: Donald Trump is now expected to win the upcoming U.S. elections, according to bookies, who expect RFK Jr’s decision to exit the race could tip the vot...

item.title: Less Is More at Builders FirstSource
item.description: The building-supply giant is growing while shrinking its share count, delighting shareholders.

item.title: ‘We shared all our assets prior to our marriage’: My husband inherited his parents’ home and didn’t put my name on the deed. What can I do?
item.description: “We have no wills at this point, and we live in California.”

item.title: How Taylor Swift Fans Broke Economics
item.description: Swifties have the same mental biases as the rest of us, making them reluctant to sell even at eye-watering prices.

item.title: Clint Eastwood lived in this 100-year-old Carmel, Calif., home when he was mayor, now it’s for sale for $21 million
item.description: Actor and director Clint Eastwood spent two years as mayor of Carmel-by-the-Sea living in this Spanish-Revival home a block from the ocean.

item.title: Schwab Wants to Fix Its Bank. Investors Are Skeptical.
item.description: The brokerage’s playbook of making easy money on customer deposits was upended when interest rates rose rapidly. Now, it is looking to change how it u...

item.title: Warriors owner Joe Lacob is selling this unbelievable Billionaires Beach mansion in Malibu for a whopping $44 million
item.description: The billionaire’s opulent oceanfront abode is sleek and modern with a ‘whiff of James Bond-villain vibe.’

item.title: How Inflation and Overspending Are Keeping Gen Z Stuck in a Debt Trap
item.description: A podcast series about how young borrowers got into so much debt so fast and what they can do to manage it.

item.title: Hedge funds have refrained from investing in the rebound rally, Goldman says
item.description: Hedge funds have overall cut their exposure to equity markets since the unwinding of the yen carry trade in early August, analysis from Goldman Sachs’...
